summary: This document is a collection of FAA forms and legal agreements related to the registration, financing, and security interest for a Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A (serial RK-244). It details the aircraft's registration number changes (N493LX to N188TS to N188TH), ownership by ThorAir LLC, and a secured loan agreement with Fifth Third Bank. The file includes assignment forms, renewal applications, and the Aircraft Security Agreement establishing the bank's lien on the aircraft. This is an Aircraft Security Agreement between Fifth Third Bank (Secured Party) and ThorAir, LLC (Grantor), establishing a security interest in a Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A aircraft and related equipment as collateral for a loan. The document details extensive obligations of ThorAir regarding maintenance, insurance, and operation of the aircraft, and the remedies available to the bank in case of default. This document is a compilation of FAA filings related to the registration, ownership transfers, and security agreements for a Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A (registration N493LX, serial RK-244). It details the aircraft's transfer from multiple co-owners to Flight Options, LLC, and later to ThorAir, LLC, along with associated liens and releases involving financial institutions like Fifth Third Bank and The Prudential Insurance Company of America. The filings include bills of sale, security agreements, and de-registration authorizations. This document is a set of FAA filings related to the registration and financing of a Raytheon 400A aircraft (tail number N493LX). It includes an Aircraft Mortgage and Security Agreement between Flight Options, LLC (grantor) and FO Financing, LLC (mortgagee), an Aircraft Registration Application listing Shmitka Air, Inc. as an applicant, and a Bill of Sale from Wells Fargo Bank to Flight Options, LLC. The filings detail the fractional ownership interests in the aircraft and establish a security interest for a loan.

keyFacts: The aircraft (Raytheon 400A, serial RK-244) is owned by ThorAir LLC, based in Sandusky, Ohio.
The aircraft's registration number changed multiple times: originally N493LX, then to N188TS in 2014, and later to N188TH in 2021.
Fifth Third Bank holds a secured interest in the aircraft via an Aircraft Security Agreement dated December 27, 2013, amended in 2019.
The documents show routine FAA administrative processes for aircraft registration, renewal, and security interest recording.
The aircraft is subject to an Engine Maintenance Agreement with Williams International Co., LLC.

The collateral is a Raytheon Aircraft Company 400A aircraft (Airframe) with Williams International FJ44-3AP Series engines, identified by a U.S. Registration Number and serial numbers on Schedule 1 (not included in this chunk).

ThorAir, LLC is required to maintain extensive insurance on the aircraft, including liability ($50M+ per occurrence), all-risk physical damage, and war risk coverage, with Fifth Third Bank named as an additional insured and loss payee.
The agreement requires ThorAir to subordinate payment on a $2,500,000 note obligation owed to ThorSport, Inc., until its obligations to Fifth Third Bank are paid in full.
The document is governed by Ohio law, and ThorAir irrevocably consents to the jurisdiction of Ohio state and federal courts.
The agreement was signed on or about December 14, 2013, as indicated by the notarization date on the signature page.
Aircraft N493LX (Raytheon 400A, serial RK-244) was owned by numerous fractional co-owners before being consolidated under Flight Options, LLC in 2011.
Flight Options, LLC used the aircraft as collateral for a loan from The Prudential Insurance Company of America, secured by a detailed security agreement filed with the FAA.
In December 2013, ownership of the aircraft was transferred from Flight Options, LLC to ThorAir, LLC via an intermediary sale to Nextant Aerospace, LLC.
ThorAir, LLC immediately secured financing from Fifth Third Bank, granting the bank an Irrevocable De-Registration and Export Request Authorization (IDERA) for the aircraft.
The document trail shows the aircraft was used for international flights to Canada, with declarations filed with the FAA to support expedited registration.
The aircraft involved is a Raytheon Aircraft Company Model 400A, serial number RK-244, U.S. Registration No. N493LX.
The aircraft is subject to a complex fractional ownership structure, with interests held by multiple entities including Flight Options, LLC and Shmitka Air, Inc.
Flight Options, LLC granted a first-priority security interest in the aircraft to FO Financing, LLC to secure a loan under a Credit and Security Agreement.
The mortgage document references the Cape Town Convention, indicating an international interest was registered for the aircraft.
The documents show a chain of title transfers, including from Wells Fargo Bank (as Trustee) and Mountville Mills, Inc. to Flight Options, LLC.
